posts.post_content:
Interesting fact:  
If you read the Savor the Flavor article about [Geist of Saint Traft](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Geist of Saint Traft) called The Saint, the Geist, and the Angel, you see that when alive, Saint Traft was tricked into killing a cultist with the Binding Blade, which then freed Withengar who then killed Saint Traft. The guilt of freeing a demon is what caused his spirit to become restless and keep on fighting evil forever.
posts.html:

The guilt of freeing a demon is what caused his spirit to become restless and keep on fighting evil forever.

Posted By: PhantomDust (2/1/2012 10:26:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
*"Plus, he's technically colorless, which makes him all the more hilarious."*  
That is not correct.  
Note the black circle to the left of the word "Legendary". That has rules implications. It means that the card is the colors shown inside circle. It replaces the need for cards without mana costs to say "this card is black", etc.
posts.html:

Posted By: blurrymadness (1/29/2013 2:44:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Great card for multiplayer. Those formats tend to be slow enough to get the dagger out and swing with it. Baring combo shenanigans and whatnot, he will most likely be the biggest thing on the board with 3 forms of evasion. And when someone loses he gets twice as big.  
  
Though I recommend playing with colors that can protect him when he is unleashed. ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) fit that bill.
posts.html:
Great card for multiplayer. Those formats tend to be slow enough to get the dagger out and swing with it. Baring combo shenanigans and whatnot, he will most likely be the biggest thing on the board with 3 forms of evasion. And when someone loses he gets twice as big.

Though I recommend playing with colors that can protect him when he is unleashed. fit that bill.

Posted By: TherealphatMatt (10/1/2012 2:22:01 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I love how well this card works in blue/black decks. Both colors have a lot of flying and unblockable. I personally swapped out the Stromkirk Nobles for Tormented Souls in my Vampire deck, just so I could run this singleton as a spare win condition. Surprises a lot of control decks who don't take care of Tormented Soul early, and instead take out the flying vamps.
posts.html:
